prompt: Write a humorous poem for Thursday
poem:
Oh Thursday, you cheeky midweek tease,
With the weekend in sight, yet you playfully freeze
The hands of the clock, so slowly they tick,
Making Friday feel like a century away – oh, slick!

You’re neither here nor there, a bit of a jest,
Not quite the start, nor the end, but doing your best.
A mimic of Monday, with less of the glum,
A prelude to Friday, with weekend’s hum.

They say “little Friday,” a hopeful moniker at best,
A mini celebration, a weekday jest.
With one foot in labor and one in rest,
We’re caught in your limbo, a peculiar test.

Thursday, you sly fox, you dress up so fine,
In promises of relaxation, soon to be mine.
Yet hours are spent dreaming, of what’s to come,
While tasks pile up, an ever-growing sum.

You're the weekly mirage, a trick of the light,
Promising oasis, but out of sight.
We chase you with memes, and coffee in streams,
Counting down hours, to weekend dreams.

So here’s to you, Thursday, with your peculiar charm,
You keep us going, with less alarm.
A beacon of hope, that the end is near,
Thank you, dear Thursday, for bringing us cheer.
